content.question: Sandro Botticelli’s painting Birth of Venus and Albrecht Dürer’s engraving Adam and Eve are similar in that both artists

choices.label: combined deep space with dramatic light to create emotional scenes
relied on classical models to represent the concept of ideal beauty
set their figures in exotic landscapes that were intriguing to the viewers
used decorative patterning and harmonious colors to create serene images

content.answer: relied on classical models to represent the concept of ideal beauty

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Explain how two or more works of art are similar and/or different in how they convey meaning.
